title: Bezai
html: BEZAI(Beʹzai) [shortened form of Bezalel].1. An Israelite whose descendants numbering over 300 returned to Jerusalem with Zerubbabel in 537 B.C.E.—Ezr 2:17; Ne 7:23.2. One by this name, or a representative of such a family group, who attested to Nehemiah’s “trustworthy arrangement.”—Ne 9:38; 10:1, 14, 18.
